page.title: 02SHERE AND GOMSHALL
page.content: Shere village and nearby Gomshall are both recorded in the first Domesday book. In 1086 Shere was known as ESSIRA a Saxon village with a church and some thirty families. Gomshall was known as GOMESELE with over forty families. Together there was a population of about 200 people. Shere was very much a farming community in those early days. In 1985 the villages of Shere and Gomshsll share a population of around 5000 people. Shere is certainly a centre for visitors,it is a considerable tourist attraction throughout the year. It is a lively picturesque village with its shops and inns full of local life, with Tillingbourne stream making an idyllic setting. Gomshall around the mill makes a favourite tourist attraction in 1985.
